import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
print("------Modules-Imported------")
source.0243ef1b:
dataset.dropna(inplace=True) # Removing Irrelevent Values and columns
dataset.drop(columns={'ad_id','reporting_end','fb_campaign_id'},inplace=True)
dataset.head(10)
source.564ad773:
sum_df,mean_df = sum_mean(dataset,'reporting_start',['clicks','spent','total_conversion','approved_conversion'])
dt1 = pd.DataFrame(sum_df)
dt1.columns = ['reporting_start','clicks','spent','total_conversion','approved_conversion']
dt1['reporting_start'] = pd.to_datetime(dt1['reporting_start'])
dt_sorted = dt1.sort_values(by="reporting_start")
dt_sorted.head()
source.2d935ece:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
for i in ['clicks','spent','total_conversion','approved_conversion']:
    plt.plot(dt_sorted['reporting_start'],dt_sorted[i],label=f'{i}')
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('Time')
plt.ylabel('Total')
plt.title('Various Attrbutes v/s Time')
plt.grid()

colors = ['#75daef','#75daff','#f990f6','#75daef','#f990fc','#f990fc','#f990fc','#75daff']
dataset[['gender','age']].value_counts().plot.pie(explode=[0,0,0.2,0,0.2,0.2,0.2,0],autopct='%1.1f%%',colors=colors)

source.32127861:
# plt.scatter(dataset['age'],dataset['clicks'],alpha=0.4)
plt.figure(figsize=(20,8))
plt.subplot(1,3,1)
plt.scatter(dataset['age'],dataset['interest1'],alpha=0.4,label='Interest 1')
plt.ylabel('Interests')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.legend()
plt.subplot(1,3,2)
plt.scatter(dataset['age'],dataset['interest2'],alpha=0.4,label='Interest 2')
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.subplot(1,3,3)
plt.scatter(dataset['age'],dataset['interest3'],alpha=0.4,label='Interest 3')
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.suptitle('Interest Division in Different Age',fontsize=20)
source.14a9c1e9:
sum_df,mean_df = sum_mean(dataset,'age',['interest1','interest2','interest3'])
dt1 = pd.DataFrame(sum_df)
dt1.columns =['age','interest1','interest2','interest3']

dt1.plot.bar()
plt.xticks(np.arange(4),dt1['age'],rotation = 0)
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.ylabel('Total Interest')
plt.title('Total Interest in Age groups')

plt.ylabel('Mean Interest')
plt.title('Mean Interest in Age groups')

source.8b51e405:
sum_df,_ = sum_mean(dataset,'age',['clicks','total_conversion','approved_conversion']) 
dt1 = pd.DataFrame(sum_df)
dt1.columns = ['age','clicks','total_conversion','approved_conversion']

plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
plt.subplot(1,3,1)
plt.bar(dt1['age'],dt1['clicks'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba','#acefbd','#afbdce'])
plt.ylabel('Total Clicks')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.xticks(np.arange(4),dt1['age'],rotation = 0)

plt.subplot(1,3,2)
plt.bar(dt1['age'],dt1['total_conversion'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba','#acefbd','#afbdce'])
plt.ylabel('Total Conversion')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.xticks(np.arange(4),dt1['age'],rotation = 0)

plt.subplot(1,3,3)
plt.bar(dt1['age'],dt1['approved_conversion'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba','#acefbd','#afbdce'])
plt.ylabel('Total Approved Conversion')
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.xticks(np.arange(4),dt1['age'],rotation = 0)

plt.suptitle('Stats by Age',fontsize=20)
source.cb6e9867:
sum_df,_ = sum_mean(dataset,'gender',['impressions','spent'])
dt2 = pd.DataFrame(sum_df)
dt2.columns =['gender','impressions','spent']

plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
plt.bar(dt2['gender'],dt2['impressions'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba'])
plt.ylabel('Total Impressions')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.xticks(np.arange(2),dt2['gender'],rotation = 0)

plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.bar(dt2['gender'],dt2['spent'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba'])
plt.ylabel('Total Spents')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.xticks(np.arange(2),dt2['gender'],rotation = 0)
plt.suptitle('Impressions and Spent in Gender')

source.8f66203e:
sum_df,_ = sum_mean(dataset,'campaign_id',['impressions','spent'])
dt2 = pd.DataFrame(sum_df)
dt2.columns =['campaign_id','impressions','spent']

plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
plt.bar(dt2['campaign_id'],dt2['impressions'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba','#acefbd'])
plt.ylabel('Total Impressions')
plt.xlabel('Campaign_id')
plt.xticks(np.arange(3),dt2['campaign_id'],rotation = 0)

plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.bar(dt2['campaign_id'],dt2['spent'],color=['#abcdef','#fedcba','#acefbd'])
plt.ylabel('Total Spents')
plt.xlabel('Campaign_id')
plt.xticks(np.arange(3),dt2['campaign_id'],rotation = 0)
plt.suptitle('Impressions and Spent in different Campaingns')
source.114f17d1:
# About the Dataset

Simple Dataset from different marketing campaigns conducted by facebook.

The total conversion number shows the total number of signups or installs for instance while approved conversions tells how many became actual active users.

Attributes:

  1. ad_id
  2. reporting_start
  3. reporting_end
  4. campaign_id
  5. fb_campaign_id
  6. age
  7. gender
  8. interest1
  9. interest2
  10. interest3
  11. impressions
  12. clicks
  13. spent
  14. total_conversion
  15. approved_conversion
